metadata.title: Medical devices — Quality management systems — Requirements for regulatory purposes

key_points: Applies to organizations in one or more stages of medical device lifecycle
Includes design, development, production, storage, distribution, installation
Applicable to associated services and post-market activities
Applies to suppliers and external parties providing products/services

references.title: Quality management systems — Fundamental principles and vocabulary

sections.description: Complete definitions of 20 key terms used throughout the standard

definitions.definition: Notice distributed by the organization, following delivery of a medical device, to provide supplementary information or recommendations for corrective or preventive action
Natural or legal person established in a country or jurisdiction, mandated in writing by a manufacturer to act on their behalf within specific regulatory obligation tasks
Evaluation and analysis of clinical data relating to a medical device to verify clinical safety and performance when used as intended by the manufacturer

Written, electronic, or verbal communication about deficiencies related to identity, quality, durability, reliability, usability, safety or performance of a medical device no longer under organizational control
Natural or legal person in the supply chain who, in their own name, contributes to making a medical device available to the end-user
Medical device that can only be removed by medical or surgical intervention and is designed to be implanted wholly or partly in the human body
Natural or legal person in the supply chain who is the first person to make a medical device produced in another country/jurisdiction available in their jurisdiction
Label, instructions for use, and any other information related to identification, technical description, destination and correct use of medical device, excluding shipping documents
All phases of a medical device's life, from initial conception to final decommissioning and disposal
Natural or legal person responsible for design and/or manufacture of a medical device to make it available for use, in their name
Instrument, apparatus, equipment, machine, device, implant, in vitro reagent, software, material or other similar or associated article intended for use in human beings for specific medical purposes

definitions.term: Famille de dispositifs médicaux (Medical Device Family)
definitions.definition: Group of medical devices manufactured by the same organization with the same basic design characteristics and performance in terms of safety, intended use or function
Evaluation and analysis of data to establish or verify the ability of an in vitro diagnostic medical device to fulfill its intended use

definitions.term: Surveillance après mise sur le marché (Post-Market Surveillance)
definitions.definition: Systematic process of collection and analysis of experience gained from medical devices that have been made available
Result of a process; includes services and outputs of products/services processes
Product supplied by an external party to the organization's QMS
Combination of the probability of harm and its severity
Systematic application of management policies, procedures and practices to tasks of risk analysis, evaluation, control and mitigation

definitions.term: Système de barrière stérile (Sterile Barrier System)
definitions.definition: Minimal packaging that prevents microorganism penetration and permits aseptic product presentation at the point of use
Medical device designed to meet sterile state requirements

sections.section_name: Système de management de la qualité (Quality Management System)
sections.description: Core QMS requirements including documentation and general requirements

subsections.description: Fundamental QMS establishment and maintenance requirements

procedures.title: QMS Documentation and Implementation
procedures.what_is_required: Organization must document and maintain an effective QMS in accordance with standard requirements and applicable regulatory requirements
key_requirements: Document QMS and maintain its effectiveness
Establish, implement and maintain all documented requirements
Document organization role(s) under applicable regulatory requirements
implementation_steps: 1. Define organizational roles (manufacturer, authorized representative, importer, distributor)
2. Document all QMS procedures and processes
procedures.examples: An organization involved in device production must document its role as 'Manufacturer' and align all QMS requirements with applicable regulations in their jurisdiction

procedures.title: Process Determination and Risk-Based Approach
procedures.what_is_required: Determine necessary QMS processes, apply risk-based approach, and define process sequence/interactions
key_requirements: Apply risk-based approach to process control
Determine sequence and interaction of processes
implementation_steps: 3. Perform risk assessment for each process
4. Define control measures based on risk level
procedures.examples: Manufacturing process receives higher control level than administrative process due to direct product impact

procedures.title: Process Effectiveness and Control Criteria
procedures.what_is_required: For each QMS process, establish effectiveness criteria, ensure resources, implement necessary actions, monitor/measure/analyze, and maintain records
key_requirements: Implement necessary actions for planned results
procedures.examples: Sterilization process KPI: 100% sterility assurance with SAL 10^-6; manufacturing process KPI: zero defects with 99.5% conformance

procedures.title: Process Management and Modification Control
procedures.what_is_required: Manage QMS processes in accordance with requirements; evaluate modifications for impact on QMS and medical devices; control modifications
key_requirements: Manage processes per standard and regulatory requirements
Evaluate impact on produced medical devices
Control modifications per standard and regulatory requirements
procedures.examples: Change from supplier A to supplier B requires: supplier evaluation, product testing, documentation update, and verification before implementation

procedures.title: Outsourced Process Management
procedures.what_is_required: When outsourcing processes affecting product conformity, monitor, control, and remain responsible; establish written quality agreements
procedures.examples: Outsourced sterilization: Include specific sterilization process validation requirements, parameters, traceability, and SAL requirements in agreement

procedures.title: Software Application Validation
procedures.what_is_required: Document procedures for validation of software applications used in QMS; validate before first use and after modifications; maintain records
procedures.examples: ERP system used for traceability: Initial validation includes testing of record creation, modification, and retrieval functions; revalidation required after system updates

subsections.subsection_name: Exigences relatives à la documentation (Documentation Requirements)
subsections.description: Requirements for QMS documentation including manual, device file, and record control

procedures.title: QMS Documentation Generalities
procedures.what_is_required: QMS documentation must include quality policy, quality objectives, quality manual, documented procedures, and records as required by standard
documentation_components: Documented procedures and records required by standard
Documents needed for effective process planning and control
Documentation specified by applicable regulatory requirements
procedures.examples: Quality manual includes: organizational overview, QMS scope, documented procedures overview, and process interactions

procedures.title: Quality Manual Development and Maintenance
procedures.what_is_required: Develop and maintain quality manual including QMS scope with justification of exclusions, documented procedures reference, and process interactions description
manual_content_requirements: QMS scope with detailed exclusions justification
procedures.examples: If design control excluded per regulatory approval, manual must document: 'Design control (section 7.3) is excluded because approved medical device designs per PMDA regulations'

procedures.title: Medical Device File (MDR) Development and Maintenance
procedures.what_is_required: For each device type/family, establish and maintain file(s) containing documents proving conformity to standard and regulatory requirements
mdr_content_requirements: General device description with intended use and labelling
Manufacturing, packaging, storage, handling and distribution specifications
procedures.examples: MDR for cardiac stent includes: product description, material specs, manufacturing process, sterilization validation, clinical data, and shelf-life documentation

procedures.title: Document Control Procedure
procedures.what_is_required: Control QMS documents; documented procedure defining controls for review, approval, version status, availability, readability, identification, obsolescence, and external documents
document_control_requirements: Review and approve documents before distribution
Ensure version status and changes are identified
Ensure current versions available at use points
Ensure documents remain legible and identifiable
procedures.examples: Procedure QMS-001 Rev. B: Released date 2024, approved by QA Manager, 45 copies distributed, obsolete Rev. A retained for 5 years per retention policy

procedures.title: Record Control and Management
procedures.what_is_required: Maintain records proving QMS conformity and effectiveness; document procedures for record identification, storage, security, integrity, accessibility, retention, and disposal
record_control_requirements: Identify, store, protect and ensure record integrity
Retain records for device lifetime minimum 2 years
procedures.examples: Batch record for cardiac stent: retained for device lifetime + 2 years minimum; stored in secure archive; access restricted to quality personnel; any corrections made with dates and signatures

sections.description: Leadership, commitment, quality policy, planning, and management review

procedures.title: Management Commitment and Leadership
procedures.what_is_required: Top management must demonstrate commitment to QMS development, implementation, and effectiveness by: communicating importance of customer/regulatory compliance, establishing quality policy, ensuring quality objectives, conducting management reviews, and ensuring resource availability
key_actions: Communicate importance of satisfying customer and regulatory requirements
procedures.examples: CEO publicly commits to zero-defect policy, ensures quarterly management reviews, and allocates budget for quality improvements

procedures.title: Customer Focus and Orientation
procedures.what_is_required: Management must ensure customer requirements and applicable regulatory requirements are determined and met

procedures.title: Quality Policy Development and Communication
procedures.what_is_required: Management must ensure quality policy is: appropriate to organization purpose, includes commitment to requirement satisfaction and QMS effectiveness, provides framework for quality objectives, is communicated and understood
policy_requirements: Includes commitment to maintain QMS effectiveness
procedures.examples: Quality Policy: 'We are committed to designing, manufacturing, and delivering medical devices that meet all customer and regulatory requirements, with zero tolerance for non-conformities'

procedures.title: Quality Objectives Setting
procedures.what_is_required: Management must ensure quality objectives including those needed for product requirements and regulatory requirements are established for appropriate functions/levels, measurable and consistent with quality policy
objective_requirements: Established for appropriate functions and levels
procedures.examples: Manufacturing: 'Achieve 99.5% first-pass yield'; Quality: 'Zero critical non-conformities'; Delivery: '100% on-time delivery'

procedures.title: QMS Planning and Modification Management
procedures.what_is_required: Management must ensure QMS planning is realized to satisfy requirements; ensure QMS coherence is not affected when planning modifications
planning_requirements: QMS planning aimed at satisfying section 4.1 requirements
QMS planning aimed at achieving quality objectives
Planning ensures QMS coherence when modifications implemented

procedures.title: Responsibility and Authority Definition
procedures.what_is_required: Management must ensure responsibilities and authorities are defined, documented, and communicated; document links between people managing/performing quality-affecting work and ensure necessary autonomy/authority
procedures.examples: Quality Manager has authority to halt production, reject materials, and approve deviations; Manufacturing Manager cannot override quality decisions

procedures.title: Management Representative Designation
procedures.what_is_required: Designate a management member with responsibility and authority to: ensure quality management processes are documented; report QMS effectiveness to management; ensure regulatory requirement awareness throughout organization
representative_responsibilities: Ensure necessary QMS processes are documented
Report QMS effectiveness and improvement needs to management
Ensure regulatory requirement awareness throughout organization
procedures.examples: Quality Assurance Director appointed as Management Representative with direct report to CEO and authority to allocate QMS resources

procedures.title: Internal Communication Management
procedures.what_is_required: Management must ensure appropriate communication processes are established and QMS effectiveness communication takes place
procedures.examples: Weekly quality meetings, monthly management briefings, quarterly all-hands meetings discussing QMS effectiveness

procedures.title: Management Review Procedure and Frequency
procedures.what_is_required: Document procedures for management review; conduct reviews at planned documented intervals to ensure QMS remains appropriate, adequate and effective; include improvement evaluation and system modification needs
review_requirements: Ensure QMS is appropriate, adequate and effective
procedures.examples: Quarterly management review held second Friday of each quarter, attended by CEO, Quality Manager, Production Manager, and Engineering Manager

procedures.title: Management Review Input Elements
procedures.what_is_required: Management review input must include information from: feedback, complaint handling, regulatory authority reporting, audits, process monitoring, product monitoring, corrective/preventive actions, previous review actions, changes affecting QMS, and new/revised regulatory requirements
procedures.examples: Review input includes: 50 customer compliments, 2 complaints resolved, 0 regulatory issues, 95% audit conformance, 98% on-time delivery

procedures.title: Management Review Output and Decisions
procedures.what_is_required: Record management review outputs including: reviewed inputs, decisions/actions on: necessary improvements, product improvement per customer requirements, regulatory requirement changes, and resource needs
output_requirements: Document decisions on regulatory requirement changes
procedures.examples: Review output: Approved new supplier approval procedure, allocated budget for calibration equipment, implemented customer feedback system, scheduled regulatory compliance training

sections.description: Personnel, infrastructure, and work environment requirements

procedures.title: Resource Provision and Availability
procedures.what_is_required: Organization must determine and provide resources necessary to: implement QMS and maintain its effectiveness; satisfy applicable regulatory requirements and customer requirements

procedures.title: Human Resources Competency Management
procedures.what_is_required: Personnel performing quality-affecting work must be competent based on education, training, skill and experience; document processes to define competencies, provide training, ensure awareness
competency_requirements: Ensure personnel awareness of activities relevance and quality objective contribution
procedures.examples: Manufacturing technician: Initial training on machine operation, SOP compliance, quality procedures, GMP principles; Annual refresher training; Competency verified quarterly

procedures.title: Infrastructure Requirements and Maintenance
procedures.what_is_required: Document infrastructure requirements necessary for product conformity; prevent product mixing; ensure orderly handling; document maintenance requirements including maintenance intervals when affecting product quality
maintenance_requirements: Apply to: production equipment, environmental control, monitoring/measurement equipment
procedures.examples: Manufacturing equipment: Scheduled maintenance every 250 hours, calibration every 6 months; Environmental monitoring: Temperature recorded daily; HVAC serviced quarterly

procedures.title: Work Environment Control
procedures.what_is_required: Document work environment requirements necessary for product conformity; when environmental conditions can negatively impact product quality, document requirements and monitoring/control procedures; document health, cleanliness and clothing requirements when personnel contact affects device safety/performance
procedures.examples: Clean room: Class 7 per ISO 14644; temperature 20-24°C, humidity 45-55%; personnel: medical examination, training, proper gowning; daily environmental monitoring recorded

procedures.title: Contamination Control
procedures.what_is_required: When appropriate, plan and document special provisions for contaminated or potentially contaminated product control to prevent environment, personnel or product contamination; for sterile devices, document microorganism/particle contamination control requirements and maintain required cleanliness during assembly/packaging
procedures.examples: Sterile device packaging: ISO Class 5 environment, particle counts <352 particles/m³; daily monitoring; any particle levels >threshold triggers investigation and corrective action

sections.description: Core product/service creation processes from planning through post-delivery

procedures.title: Product Realization Planning
procedures.what_is_required: Plan and develop necessary processes for product realization; ensure planning is consistent with other QMS requirements; document risk management processes; determine quality objectives, processes, resources, verification/validation/monitoring/testing/acceptance criteria, records
planning_requirements: Determine quality objectives and product requirements
procedures.examples: Product realization plan for implantable device includes: design validation protocol, biocompatibility testing, sterilization validation, stability study, clinical data

procedures.title: Product Requirement Determination
procedures.what_is_required: Determine: customer-specified requirements including delivery/post-delivery activities; requirements not stated but necessary for specified use; applicable regulatory requirements; user training necessary for specified performance and safe use; additional organization-determined requirements
procedures.examples: Insulin pump requirements: customer specifies flow rate ±2% accuracy; implied: biocompatibility, sterility for implantable parts; regulatory: FDA 510(k) requirements; training: user manual for patient operation

procedures.title: Product Requirement Review
procedures.what_is_required: Review product requirements before committing to supply (e.g., bid submission, contract acceptance, order acceptance); ensure: requirements are defined/documented, no conflicts with prior requirements, regulatory requirements satisfied, user training available/planned, organization can meet requirements; maintain review records
procedures.examples: Customer request for device in new material: Review confirms biocompatibility data available, manufacturing capability exists, timeline feasible, approved with procurement of new material and validation testing

procedures.title: Customer Communication
procedures.what_is_required: Plan and document customer communication arrangements about: product information, inquiry/contract/order handling including modifications, customer feedback including complaints, warning notices; communicate with regulatory authorities per regulatory requirements
procedures.examples: Communication plan: Product info via website/brochures, orders via online portal/phone, feedback via email/phone, complaints via dedicated hotline, regulatory updates via registered mail

sections.section_name: Mesurage, analyse et amélioration (Measurement, Analysis and Improvement)
sections.description: Monitoring, feedback, analysis, and continuous improvement

procedures.title: Monitoring, Measurement, Analysis and Improvement Planning
procedures.what_is_required: Plan and implement necessary monitoring, measurement, analysis and improvement processes to: demonstrate product conformity, ensure QMS conformity, maintain QMS effectiveness; determine appropriate methods including statistical techniques and extent of use

procedures.title: Customer Feedback and Satisfaction Monitoring
procedures.what_is_required: Collect and monitor customer information regarding level of satisfaction with organization as measure of QMS effectiveness; document methods to obtain/use information; document feedback process including production and post-production data collection
procedures.examples: Annual customer satisfaction survey with 90% response rate; questions on product quality, delivery, service; results analyzed by product line; improvement actions tracked

procedures.title: Complaint Management and Handling
procedures.what_is_required: Document procedures for complaint handling in appropriate timeframe per regulatory requirements; define requirements/responsibilities for: receipt/recording, evaluation to determine if complaint, complaint analysis, determination of regulatory reporting necessity, product treatment, correction/corrective action necessity; maintain complaint records
procedures.examples: Customer complains device not sterile: Complaint logged same day, investigation launched, batch traced, sterility testing performed, root cause identified (packaging integrity), corrective action implemented, customer notified

procedures.title: Regulatory Authority Reporting
procedures.what_is_required: When applicable regulatory requirements require notification of complaints meeting specified criteria, adverse events, or warning notice distribution, document procedures to provide notification to appropriate regulatory authorities
procedures.examples: FDA MedWatch: Device causes hospitalization, reported to FDA within 15 days including device details, patient information, and company investigation findings

procedures.title: Internal Audit Procedure
procedures.what_is_required: Conduct internal audits at planned intervals to determine if QMS: conforms to planned arrangements, standard requirements, organization requirements, regulatory requirements; is effectively implemented/maintained; document audit procedures, auditor selection/conduct, criteria, scope, interval, methods; record audit results, conclusions; ensure management takes necessary corrective action
procedures.examples: Quarterly audit of manufacturing: Check equipment maintenance, personnel training, document control, product traceability, and corrective action closure; results shared with management

procedures.title: Process Monitoring and Measurement
procedures.what_is_required: Use appropriate methods to monitor and, when applicable, measure QMS processes; methods must demonstrate process capability to achieve planned results; when planned results not achieved, implement corrections and corrective actions
procedures.examples: Manufacturing process: Monitor defect rate daily, yield weekly, on-time delivery monthly; if defect rate >0.5%, trigger investigation and corrective action

procedures.title: Product Monitoring and Measurement
procedures.what_is_required: Monitor and measure product characteristics to verify requirement satisfaction; perform at applicable product realization stages per planned procedures; maintain conformance proof; record authorization person identity; when applicable, identify test equipment used; do not release product/service before satisfactory completion
procedures.examples: Device production: Incoming material testing, dimension verification during assembly, sterility testing for final product, all results recorded and dated by authorized personnel

procedures.title: Non-Conforming Product Control
procedures.what_is_required: Ensure non-conforming product is identified and controlled to prevent unintended use/delivery; document procedure for control measures, responsibilities/authorities for product identification, documentation, isolation, evaluation and treatment; evaluate non-conformity including need for expertise and notification of external party
procedures.examples: Device fails sterility test: Immediately segregated, investigation launched, root cause identified, batch quarantined, customer notification issued if any shipped

procedures.title: Non-Conformity Actions Before Delivery
procedures.what_is_required: When non-conformity detected before delivery, treat product by: taking action to eliminate non-conformity, taking action to prevent original use, or authorizing use by waiver if justified, approved, and regulatory requirements satisfied
implementation_steps: 4. If rework approved: perform and verify
procedures.examples: Device dimension slightly out of tolerance: Assessment shows acceptable performance, deviation approved by engineering and quality, device released with documentation

procedures.title: Non-Conformity Actions After Delivery
procedures.what_is_required: When non-conformity detected after delivery, take appropriate actions based on real/potential non-conformity effects; document procedures for warning notice distribution per regulatory requirements; ensure results achieved or implement corrections/corrective actions if not
procedures.examples: Device safety issue discovered: FDA notified, customer warning issued, device recalled, root cause corrected, design modified, new production validated, customers updated

procedures.title: Rework and Reprocessing Control
procedures.what_is_required: Perform rework per documented procedures accounting for potential negative effects; procedures subject to same review/approval as initial procedures; after rework, verify product satisfies acceptance criteria/regulatory requirements
procedures.examples: Implant surface rework: Procedure reviewed and approved, coating reapplied, surface analysis repeated to confirm compliance, device re-sterilized and tested

procedures.title: Data Analysis and Evaluation
procedures.what_is_required: Document procedures to determine, collect and analyze appropriate data demonstrating QMS relevance, adequacy and effectiveness; include data from monitoring/measurement and other sources; include feedback, conformity data, process/product characteristics, trends, improvement opportunities; when data shows system not appropriate/adequate/effective, use for improvement per section 8.5
procedures.examples: Monthly data analysis shows complaint trend increasing; investigation reveals new supplier material variation; corrective action implemented: supplier quality agreement updated

procedures.title: Improvement Planning and Implementation
procedures.what_is_required: Identify and implement necessary modifications to ensure ongoing relevance, adequacy and effectiveness of QMS and medical device safety/performance using quality policy, objectives, audit results, post-market surveillance, data analysis, corrective/preventive actions, and management review
procedures.examples: Opportunity identified: Average lead time 8 weeks, customer needs 6 weeks; improvement team implements parallel processing, reduces lead time to 5 weeks, customer satisfied

procedures.title: Corrective Action Procedure
procedures.what_is_required: Implement actions to eliminate non-conformity causes to prevent recurrence; all necessary corrective actions implemented promptly; proportionate to non-conformity effects; document procedure for: non-conformity review, root cause analysis, need assessment for corrective action, action planning/implementation/documentation, verification negative effects not introduced, corrective action effectiveness review
procedures.examples: Defects traced to supplier change: Root cause analysis reveals new supplier material hardness variance; corrective action: update supplier specifications, require incoming testing, verify 3 good batches

procedures.title: Preventive Action Procedure
procedures.what_is_required: Determine actions to eliminate potential non-conformity causes to prevent occurrence; proportionate to effects; document procedure for: potential non-conformity determination, root cause analysis, need assessment for preventive action, action planning/implementation/documentation, verification negative effects not introduced, preventive action effectiveness review when applicable
procedures.examples: Trend analysis shows sterility testing samples increasing variability; preventive action: upgrade monitoring equipment, increase sample frequency, provide technician retraining

rag_training_data.query_example: What are the requirements for design control?
rag_training_data.expected_answer: Section 7.3 covers design and development with requirements for planning, input, output, review, verification, validation, transfer, and modification control

rag_training_data.query_example: How should the organization handle customer complaints?
rag_training_data.expected_answer: Section 8.2.2 requires documented procedure for complaint handling including receipt, evaluation, analysis, regulatory reporting decision, product treatment, and corrective action determination

rag_training_data.query_example: What documentation is required for the quality system?
rag_training_data.expected_answer: Section 4.2 requires quality manual, device file, documented procedures, and records per specific requirements
